title: PacWest falls more than 50% after hours on report bank is considering strategic options
description: The stock is down 72% this year.

title: Google employees complain about CEO Sundar Pichai's pay raise as cost cuts hit rest of the company
description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai received $226 million last year, mostly through stock awards, making him one of the highest-paid CEOs in the U.S.

title: House China committee targets top clothing brands in forced labor inquiry
description: Lawmakers asked retailers Temu, Shein, Nike and Adidas about the use of materials and labor sourced from the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous region of China.

title: Billionaire Stephen Deckoff buys Jeffrey Epstein's private islands
description: Jeffrey Epstein used his private retreat in the U.S. Virgin Islands to sexually abuse multiple women. A billionaire plans a new luxury resort there.

title: Qualcomm gives light forecast, phone chip sales fall 17%
description: Qualcomm reported second-quarter earnings on Wednesday that saw sales from handset chips, a core business for the company, decline.

title: Apple expected to announce $90 billion in buybacks and dividends when it reports earnings
description: Regardless of its quarterly results, Apple will remind investors of how much cash it generates and its extreme profitability.

title: Fed increases rates a quarter point and signals a potential end to hikes
description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released its decision on interest rates following a two-day meeting.

title: Chegg shares rebound with 17% pop after losing almost half their value on ChatGPT concerns
description: Chegg CEO Dan Rosensweig told CNBC late Tuesday that the stock's 48% plunge during regular trading hours was "extraordinarily overblown."

title: Deposition of JPMorgan CEO Dimon in Jeffrey Epstein lawsuit set for late May, source says
description: Jeffrey Epstein, a sex offender who had been friends with Donald Trump and Bill Clinton, was a customer of JPMorgan Chase for years.

title: The market is looking for the next 'domino' to fall, keeping banks under pressure
description: The sharp selloff in regional banks sparked by the March failure of Silicon Valley Bank resumed Tuesday, catching Wall Street analysts and investors off guard.

title: Here's what to expect from today's Federal Reserve announcement
description: Where the intrigue comes in is how the central bank proceeds from here.

title: Eli Lilly Alzheimer’s treatment donanemab slowed disease progression in clinical trial
description: Donanemab, a monthly antibody infusion made by pharmaceutical company Eli Lilly, also significantly reduced brain plaque associated with Alzheimer's disease.

title: Top banking CEO warns of further volatility and predicts more U.S. rescues
description: A top banking executive said he expects more American banks to be rescued after JPMorgan stepped in to buy First Republic.

title: These are the top 10 most in-demand job skills right now, according to the World Economic Forum
description: As jobs are going through a transformational time, the World Economic Forum lays out the top 10 most important skills for workers, and how they'll shift.

title: South Korea's finance minister says country is at a 'turning point' in relations with Japan
description: South Korea's finance minister says the nation sees a "turning point" in economic relations with Japan.

title: Jeep, Dodge maker Stellantis posts first-quarter revenue jump as chip supply eases
description: Carmaker Stellantis on Wednesday posted a 14% annual rise in first-quarter net revenues as an easing of semiconductor supply chain pressures boosted shipments.

title: After First Republic's rescue, economists predict further pain with a 'new era' of higher inflation
description: Turmoil in the banking sector means central banks face in increasingly "delicate dance" in their efforts to rein in inflation, World Economic Forum Managing Director Saadia Zahidi told CNBC.

title: India's ties with Russia remain steady. But Moscow's tighter embrace of China makes it wary
description: Moscow has also grown close to Beijing since invading Ukraine, and that raises critical national security concerns for New Delhi.

title: Bank of Korea governor says it's 'premature' to talk about rate cuts
description: "It would be a little bit premature to talk about pivot at this moment," Bank of Korea Governor Rhee Chang-yong told CNBC.

title: Michael Milken says recent crisis is the same mistake banks have been making for decades
description: Famed investor Michael Milken said the current banking crisis stemmed from a classic asset-liability mismatch that had played out miserably time and again.
